content: So fc-multicategories/virtual double categories are a "nice place to define generalized categories" in the same way that monoidal categories are a "nice place to define generalized monoids". To define commutative monoids we need a symmetric monoidal category, (or possibly merely a braided monoidal category). Is there a published/folklore definition of what the generalization to a braided/symmetric fc-multicategory/virtual double category should be or do I need to just work out the details myself? Seems like this would be a "nice place to define generalized groupoids"
Two guesses would be it's the same as generalized multicategories with respect to the free groupoid monad or free dagger category monad
Huh? Why should the generalization of commutative monoids give you groupoids of any kind?
Are you thinking of a vdc with a "reversal" operation on 1-cells? I wouldn't call that "braided" or "symmetric", and I don't know of a definition.
Oh I guess my analogy with monoids doesn't quite make sense. But yes I'm thinking of a vdc where every "pro-arrow" can be reversed
The free †\dagger†-category monad seems like a good idea to start with.
Ah and maybe it's analogous to a star autonomous category rather than a symmetric monoidal category
Or compact closed. I'll have to think about it
